p: The genotype was identified using the Norovirus Genotyping Tool 1.0, Basic Local Alignment Search Tool (BLAST) and Human calicivirus Typing tool ( https://norovirus.phiresearchlab.org/). All genomes or complete ORF2 GII.17 sequences registered in the GenBank were used for evolutionary analysis. The final database comprised 85 sequences after data formatting using the CD-Hit program (Cluster Database at High Identity with Tolerance) to split the sequences with 100% identity (Additional file 1) [ 19]. The sequences obtained in this study were deposited in the GenBank database under accession numbers: MN045201, MN045199, MN045191, MN045193, MN045195, MN045196, MN045197, MN045200, MN045203, MN045192, MN045194, and MN045198.
